byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Morehead, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.
byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Rowan County, Ky, clerk Kim Davis continues to deny gay couples marriage licenses, in defiance of Supreme Court ruling, claiming that doing so violates her Christian beliefs; case is highest-profile instance of resistance to ruling, and is problematic because as elected official she cannot easily be removed; faces hearing in federal court about motion to hold her in contempt of court.
lead_paragraph: County Clerk Kim Davis repeatedly said that she would not issue licenses to any couples, gay or straight, “Under God’s authority.”

headline.main: Kentucky Clerk Denies Same-Sex Marriage Licenses, Defying Court
headline.print_headline: Kentucky Clerk Defies Justices on Marriages

snippet: County Clerk Kim Davis repeatedly said that she would not issue licenses to any couples, gay or straight, “Under God’s authority.”

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
